headline: Copycat Panera Broccoli Cheddar Soup
description: This broccoli Cheddar soup recipe is made with onions, carrots, celery, broccoli, and cheese for a rich and creamy, restaurant-worthy meal at home.

video.description: Find out how to make the soup from your favorite cafe right in your own kitchen.
video.name: Copycat Panera¬Æ Broccoli Cheddar Soup

name: Copycat Panera Broccoli Cheddar Soup
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Set aside.

Whisk 1/4 cup melted butter and flour together in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Continue to whisk and cook, adding 1 to 2 tablespoons of milk if necessary to keep the flour from burning, 3 to 4 minutes.

Gradually add milk while whisking constantly; stir in chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Cook until mixture is thickened, about 20 minutes. Add broccoli, carrots, celery, and saut√©ed onion; simmer until all the vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.
Stir in Cheddar cheese until melted; season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

review.reviewBody: Added some Velveeta and heavy cream. delicious!
Needed more seasoning. Added 1tsp Spike. My husband didn't like the carrots. Will leave them out next time.
It's a great Panera dupe and easy to make! I threw mine in the slow cooker after and let it simmer a few hours and it was delicious.
LOVE THIS SOUP , THANKS FOR THE RECIPE ., SIMPLY DELICIOUS

I made this recipe before, and it was delicious!! I doubled the recipe and I froze half of it, two weeks later took it out of the freezer and to my surprise, it was just as good as to when I first cooked it.

Make this! Didn‚Äôt have carrots but still perfect! Used bouillon cubes in water instead of stock. Didn‚Äôt need to add any other salt. Recommend cooking the broccoli in the broth first, using milk to whisk into roux, then adding broccoli and broth to that.
I followed the instructions & it turned out so creamy & delicious üòã definitely a saver, easy to make & soooo good
It was delicious and my kids loved it!

I would suggest omitting the celery, or drastically reducing the amount. I am a diehard fan of Panera‚Äôs cheddar broccoli soup. This recipe was great, but didn‚Äôt meet my expectations because the celery is very overpowering. Otherwise, the consistency is great. I did add garlic and salt with the milk and chicken stock because it was very bland without it.
Super easy and versatile

I absolutely love this recipe. I shred the carrots, add some garlic/onion powder, and it is VITAL to add that milk slowly and wait for the simmer until the veggies come in. Third time making it! Paired it with some Turkey BLTs. It was a hit! I always say- if you know how to cook, start with a solid base and work with it to meet your own palate. This is a solid base!
Loved the broccoli cheddar soup! Was easy to make! Had a bit left over and used it as a sauce to pour over some hot steamed broccoli.

I thought it was very good and easy to make but I did add more seasoning. I liked the of course lots of pepper, some salt and I added the ground mustard and the nutmeg but I probably pass on the nutmeg and I added paprika cause I didn‚Äôt have smoked paprika, and then I added some Tonys. The first time I made it I made 2 cups of chicken stock and 2 cups of half-and-half, but it was too rich so this time I made 2 cups of chicken stock, one cup of half-and-half, and one cup of milk I added a little bit more broccoli then it said, and I use my milk butter to grind it up not completely, but I still left texture
easy and delicious

So I've used different variations of this recipe from other websites which were just ok but left the soup kind of runny and not quite right. This one is the best but there's a critical step you can't deviate from which is step 3 of letting the liquid simmer first and adding milk gradually to control the thickness. Letting the roux and the stock simmer is the KEY. It allows you to create the liquid portion of your soup to your liking. You must also carefully manage the crunchiness of your vegetables to your liking in this step. I prefer mine slightly crunchier than the Panera version which over cooks the veggies in my opinion. This is definitely one of the best recipes for this soup and step 3 is your stick shift so you need to carefully control to your preference from here. You can also add additional seasoning at this juncture if you want.

Not sure how it will turn out, but I‚Äôm adding a correction. The recipe calls for a ‚Äústalk‚Äù of celery, which is an entire bunch! Thinking they meant a ‚Äúrib‚Äù which is one piece from the stalk.

My first time ever trying to make soup from scratch and it turned out great! Even my hubs who normally doesn't like broccoli cheddar soup loved it. I used lactose-free whole milk because that's what I had in the fridge, and to me the end result seemed a wee bit chunky. But it was still delicious! May try using 2% milk next time >.>
Seemed too cheesy
We loved it so much I'm making it again today! Salad and broiled garlic french bread slices.

Yummy! The only changes I made was to saut√© the veggies first in the butter and then cook the flour for a couple of minutes. Then I added broth, milk, and half n half. I added a pinch of red pepper flakes as well. Used freshly graded sharp cheddar. Family loved it.
Delicious! I added some a dash of nutmeg and allspice. I also added a little turmeric, cumin, chipotle, and paprika.
I have made this twice in two weeks and I'm the only one in the house that will eat brocolli. Which is just fine. More for me!! LOL It's absolutely delicious, super easy and heats well if leftover.
Fabulous
This is virtually indistinguishable from getting it at the restaurant. My whole family loved this. I usually change something about a recipe but this one is perfect as-is.
Best soup I‚Äôve ever made! Husband loved it!!!
This was easy to make and is the best broccoli cheddar soup I have ever had. My family loved it.
Wonderful and decadent!
Total Fat 23g	29% Saturated Fat 14g	72% Sodium 624mg	27% I bet it's delicious - but enough fat and sodium to kill you! I wish we could find a more healthy version? Any suggestions?

Delicious. Mine turned out very thick. Added couple cloves garlic minced, heavier onion. Maybe 2 cup broccoli. Use whole milk -- id opt 2% milk next time. Double the recipe. It made maybe 4 adult bowls.

Best soup ever!! The best soup I make is the copycat beer and cheddar soup from Jack Astors and this one just blew that out of the water!! Like holy @#$% sooooo good!! I saut√©ed some garlic in with the onion and used parmesan, old cheddar and extra old cheddar and OMG so flavorful! If you do this be careful with the parmesan cuz it's a strong flavor and salty so watch any salt you add.
my family loved this soup will make a double batch next time!
Just made it taste great, great recipe. We all make again and again and again.
I sauteed garlic with the onions. Tasted it after the milk and chicken stock was added in and it tasted bland. I added Sriracha, Adobo and Italian spices. The husband loved it!
My whole family loved it. I also added a dash of nutmeg.
Really good cheesy broccoli soup! Only change I made was that I added about 3 cups of fresh broccoli.
I made it with my instant pot and some chicken.
Good consistency and is a perfect dupe of Paneras!

This is the recipe that I use to make Panera's version, but I substitute half and half cream for the milk and add 1/3 cup dry sherry wine and 1/4 tsp nutmeg. Yup, I know, more calories, but worth it. Suggest that you taste test it after you add the cheddar but before you add salt. Depending on your cheese, there might be enough salt in it already.

Good soup! I did make changes but not drastic ones. I added garlic and two bay leaves while it simmered and I used less butter and flour (I knew the cheese would make it thick). I also used 3 cups of broth and one cup of milk. Will make a nice lunch! Thanks for the recipe.

This is very good and very easy. I increased the flour to half cup and butter to 3/4 cup then I increased the milk to about 3 cups and about 3 cups of vegetable broth instead of chicken. I added extra broccoli. I did all these changes so it would make more.
This, in my opinion, was better than the famous Panera Broccoli and cheese recipe
Taste is great
Fine good
Great recipe!!!!

Seriously an amazing recipe! I'm lactose intolerant so I used almond milk unsweetened in place of the cows milk, used lactose free butter and cheese with no issues. It was velvety, rich and oh so perfect!!
It turned out AMAZING! Recipe was easy to follow and cooking times for each step were spot on. Makes enough for 2 nice portions for dinner and left overs.

Honestly, overall it's a good recipe to use as a base when making broccoli cheese soup. I say it's a base because you really have to add extra to it to even make it a full soup that would actually serve 8 people. Starting off due instruction #2 before 1. it takes way more time to make the flour mixture before you make the onions translucent. Second, when making the flour mixture you may need to add more flour to thicken a little faster than the given time of 20 mins. I would add at least another 1/3 cup to help. After adding the flour mixture to the veggies that are cooking to soften you'll need to add at least another 2-3 cups of stock in order to cover the veggies and make it look like it will feed up to 8 servings. Then let it all simmer for about 20 mins to cook together. After all this it will taste like a broccoli cheese soup.
Delicious. Tastes just like Panera!, But not as salty. Love.
I love this recipe. It has good flavour. I usually add extra cheese to mine and extra pepper but that‚Äôs just a me thing üòÄ. It makes enough to even have leftovers.
Added a glug of chardonnay. YUM!
Too rich and cheesy for us.
Definitely needed more seasonings and flavor. I added garlic and onions saut√©ed with butter then made the roux in that mixture. Milk and cheeses added at the end and was super delicious!

Definitely flavour is subjective, so salt, pepper a little hot sauce totally improves the gfavour of the soup. Now, unless the people being served are counting serving sizes and calories, this recipe MIGHT feed 4 people, not 8 as suggested :)
Wonderful recipe nice and easy and so delicious
Excellent recipe that is delicious and has really easy ingredients that are most likely already on hand. Absolutely delicious!

Pretty good. I did opt to add extra cheese (we do love cheese in this house!) My carrots still are faintly crunchy (I think next time I may pre cook them in chicken broth) Will definitely make again. Had to be one of the most beautiful runs I've ever made!

It needed a half cup flour because it was too thin initially. After a few hours of resting, it thickened more. I added 1 teaspoon garlic paste, a half teaspoon ginger paste, hot sauce, and radishes. I used 16 ounces of Velveeta. It was just like Panera‚Äôs and was delicious. I used a hand blender so it stayed in the pot.
I USE A BIT MORE BROCCOLI AND CHICKEN BROTH MY HUSBAND LOVES IT, I DO TOO! YA GOTTA TRY IT!

The original recipe from Panera is excellent without question however, I just had to customize this Copycat a bit based on what I had available. Firstly, no chicken stock available so I used powdered chicken bases which required no additional salt added. Also, no milk or half and half so I used available heavy cream! I cut way back on the butter as there is an abundance of milk fat in heavy cream. In order to cut back on the glutenous wheat flour, I added diced potatoes to the mix and used Gluten Free rice flour to thicken. As a added flavor component I added a tablespoon of French Onion Powder and Wahlah! Pure heaven! also: used Sharp Cheddar Cheese!

I tweaked the recipe. I used 1/2 cup of butter instead of a 1/4 cup and half in half for milk. I also used red onions. I doubled the recipe because I was making it for a restaurant/bar. It turned out better than I expected. The only thing that disappointed me was it did not yield as much as I expected. I will definitely use this recipe again but I will double the ingredients.
Was a challenge to keto it but worked good as far as taste. Replaced flour and milk with Egg Yolk and coconut milk! And no carrots and celery, that was a request from hubby!
Great base but the recipe is bland. I added garlic powder and a cool runnings Caribbean seasoning and that took it up a notch!
It tastes sooo good! I followed the recipe and I only added a pinch of garlic powder. It came out perfect and so tasty. Thanks for the great recipe‚ù§Ô∏è

By the way, if you say you hate to leave a two star review and then proceed to post it twice I'm confused but anyway that's just me. I love the recipe and I added a few little things to it too but I think the author was gracious enough to suggest that.
I think the cheese killed it for me. Maybe if cheese was added separately to each bowl it would have been better. On a side note, be easy with the salt.

This recipe was AWESOME. We were a little nervous, because yesterday we went to another site and got a recipe for something else and it was really awful. This one, though, it was very good. We followed all the ingredients, as directed, and we made bread bowls to put it in. It was an absolute smash hit and my family has had nothing but good things to say about it. Worth a try for SURE.

The only change I made was that I threw the vegetables in right after I added the milk and chicken stock. After 20 minutes the veggies were tender, and the soup was thickened. No need to wait an additional 20 minutes. Verg good and will make again.
I think it tastes better then Panera‚Äôs. I put 2 1/2 cups broccoli instead of what it called for.
It says 8 serving , but it was so good my wife and ate it all for lunch. Yummy
I was out of celery, but it was still very tasty.

Good basic soup but the process is way off. 1. Melt butter and cook onion, celery and carrots (needs garlic) until tender, add flour and cook 2-3 minutes to cook the flour. 2. Slowly had broth while whisking and simmer until thickened. 3. Add broccoli and simmer about 10 minutes until broccoli is tender not mushy. Season as you like. I like a dash or two of Worcestershire. 4. Add milk or 1/2 and 1/2, bring to a bare simmer. 5. Slowly stir in cheese a handful at a time and stir until each handful is melted. 6. Check seasonings and simmer a few minutes to warm the soup through. 7. Top with crisp bacon crumbles and chopped chives. Didn't mean to hijack this recipe but you don't need 2 pans, just makes more work.
My family love this
Love it! Used 2 cups broccoli instead of 1 1/2
I go back to this specific recipe over and over again, and my family absolutely loves it! Easy to make and pleases even my kiddo who doesn't like vegetablesüôÇüëç Thank you for the great recipeüôÇ
I made this and doubled it to share - amazing will make again.

Loved the recipe, instead of regular salt, I used Himalayan pink salt and some celery salt to bump up the flavor a little. As someone who has had more gallons of the Panera soup than I care to count, this is spot on for their recipe. I do recommend chopping the broccoli finely before adding it in. Next time I will probably add 1/4 tsp nutmeg and a tsp of garlic powder. And I‚Äôll probably have my sourdough bread bowls baked by then too.
It took a little longer to make.

I liked the soup in the end, but there seemed to be too many steps with this recipe to me. I melted all the butter and sauteed the onion, carrot and celery till tinder. Then added minced garlic for a minute before adding a bit of cayenne and the flour, I used almond, worked fine. Then added the stock, smoothed the mixture before adding twice the amount of broccoli. Simmered till tinder, cutting up the broccoli before adding heavy whipping cream for the milk. Brought it to a boil to thicken. Remove from heat for a few minutes before adding the freshly grated cheese, you may want to add extra too. I would use fresh broccoli in this, I was trying to use up some frozen that had been hanging around, I think it added too much moisture to the mix. The nutmeg was a nice touch in this. Will make again!
I really enjoyed this! My family, however, weren‚Äôt fans. I‚Äôm going with my own rating.
Made this several times. Usually doubling the recipe and adding more broth.
Make this often!
Amazing! I halved the recipe and added a little extra cheese, and I added potatoes. So good!
I doubled the recipe using 2% milk and a bag of frozen broccoli tops. I don't know if it tastes like Panera's but it's delicious.
This soup is so yummy! I didn't alter the recipe at all. Perfect for a cold, rainy night.
Every one loved it in my house. Just added some chilli flakes for a little zing... thanks. Absolutely delicious
Fab !
The instructions are pretty well redacted, we did it and was extremely good for being the first time! I think after couple more times we can beat Panera üòÇüòÇüòÇ
I made it with skim milk. It still delicious

Sorry but this tastes nothing like Panera‚Äôs. I followed recipe exactly (hate when peeps change every ingredient then criticize the recipe!!). Whole milk. I feel vegs should be added at different times as they do not cook at same rate. By time broccoli and carrots were tender, onions were mush and celery was crunchy. Very bland and flavorless as is. Back to my search.

This soup was great. I doubled the recipe and it turned out fine. I did use 2% milk which was not a problem. I also saut√©ed the onions, carrots, and celery in a saut√© pan together while I melted the butter in a stock pot and whisked in the flour. You don‚Äôt have to cook the milk and flour make sure for 20 minutes to cook out the flower. I‚Äôd say less than half the time will do it. From my experience broccoli turns brown at about the 10 minute mark so I fork tested my broccoli until it was tender but with a bite. You can adjust your own seasonings so I added a little more salt and pepper and a half teaspoon of garlic powder. Definitely a keeper.
I added mushrooms just because.. So delish!
Delicious! Made as written.
AwesomeüòãüòãüòãüòãüòãI just tried a small portion so I just cut the ingredients in half‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è
More veggies, shredded cheese on top
Absolutely delicious! Will definitely make this again.
Great! Added a few seasonings (onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika) and it turned out good!

This recipe is on point! It‚Äôs so delicious that I probably ate enough for four people! The recipe is perfect as is. I‚Äôm a veggie person so I added more broccoli. I‚Äôm definitely making this again!
It was delicious and exactly what I wanted!
Really delish! Made a few changes, but mainly just saut√©ed garlic with the butter and onion and then added some seasoning.
